articles.basic_headline: ASML's order book expected to jump on AI chip boom
articles.title: ASML's order book expected to jump on AI chip boom
articles.description: ASML , the top equipment supplier to computer chip makers, is expected to report an influx of new orders when its new boss delivers second-quarter results on Wednesday, as customers expand capacity to meet booming demand for AI chips.
articles.web: ASML's order book expected to jump on AI chip boom

thumbnail.caption: A smartphone with a displayed ASML logo is placed on a computer motherboard in this illustration taken March 6, 2023. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration/File Photo
thumbnail.alt_text: Illustration shows ASML logo
thumbnail.subtitle: Illustration shows ASML logo

articles.basic_headline: Apple at all-time high after Morgan Stanley calls stock 'top pick' for AI efforts
articles.title: Apple at all-time high after Morgan Stanley calls stock 'top pick' for AI efforts
articles.description: Apple's shares rose 2.5% to a record high on Monday after Morgan Stanley raised its price target on the iPhone maker's shares and designated the stock as a "top pick," citing the company's AI efforts as a boost to device sales.
articles.web: Apple at all-time high after Morgan Stanley calls stock 'top pick' for AI efforts

thumbnail.caption: Customers walk past an Apple logo inside of an Apple store at Grand Central Station in New York, U.S., August 1, 2018. REUTERS/Lucas Jackson/File Photo
thumbnail.alt_text: Customers walk past an Apple logo inside of an Apple store at Grand Central Station in New York
thumbnail.subtitle: Customers walk past an Apple logo inside of an Apple store at Grand Central Station in New York

articles.basic_headline: Global smartphone market grew 6.5% in Q2, led by Samsung and Apple, IDC says
articles.title: Global smartphone market grew 6.5% in Q2, led by Samsung and Apple, IDC says
articles.description: Global smartphone shipments rose 6.5% in the second quarter, driven by Samsung Electronics and Apple, preliminary data from IDC showed on Monday, but a full recovery in demand is yet to come around as it remained challenged in some markets.
articles.web: Global smartphone market grew 6.5% in Q2, led by Samsung and Apple, IDC says

thumbnail.caption: An influencer poses with Samsung's new Galaxy S24 Ultra model phones offering AI functions at the Galaxy Unpacked event in San Jose, California, U.S. January 17, 2024. REUTERS/Loren Elliott/File Photo
thumbnail.alt_text: Samsung Electronics unveils Galaxy S24 smartphones at its Galaxy Unpacked event in San Jose
thumbnail.subtitle: Samsung Electronics unveils Galaxy S24 smartphones at its Galaxy Unpacked event in San Jose

articles.basic_headline: TSMC second-quarter profit seen jumping 30% on surging AI chip demand
articles.title: TSMC second-quarter profit seen jumping 30% on surging AI chip demand
articles.description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co , the main producer of advanced chips used in artificial intelligence applications, is expected to report a 30% rise in second-quarter profit on Thursday thanks to soaring demand.
articles.web: TSMC second-quarter profit seen jumping 30% on surging AI chip demand

thumbnail.caption: TSMC logo is seen at TSMC Museum of Innovation in Hsinchu, Taiwan May 29, 2024. REUTERS/Ann Wang/ File Photo
thumbnail.alt_text: TSMC logo is seen at TSMC Museum of Innovation in Hsinchu
thumbnail.subtitle: TSMC logo is seen at TSMC Museum of Innovation in Hsinchu

articles.basic_headline: Intel on track for cumulative software sales of $1 billion by end 2027, executive says
articles.title: Intel on track for cumulative software sales of $1 billion by end 2027, executive says
articles.description: Intel's push into software is going well and the company could have cumulative software revenue of $1 billion by the end of 2027, Chief Technology Officer Greg Lavender told Reuters.
articles.web: Intel on track for cumulative software sales of $1 billion by end 2027, executive says

thumbnail.caption: Intel EVP and CTO Greg Lavender speaks at the Reuters NEXT conference in Singapore July 9, 2024. REUTERS/Ore Huiying/File Photo
thumbnail.alt_text: Intel EVP and CTO Greg Lavender speaks at the Reuters NEXT conference in Singapore
thumbnail.subtitle: Intel EVP and CTO Greg Lavender speaks at the Reuters NEXT conference in Singapore

articles.basic_headline: Hedge funds turn to South Korea for next wave in AI
articles.title: Hedge funds turn to South Korea for next wave in AI
articles.description: Hedge funds hunting for artificial intelligence-related stock market bargains are rushing into South Korea's chipmakers, betting a new wave of demand for high-end memory chips and government spending makes them more valuable.
articles.web: Hedge funds turn to South Korea for next wave in AI

thumbnail.caption: AI (Artificial Intelligence) letters and robot hand are placed on computer motherboard in this illustration taken, June 23, 2023. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration/File Photo
thumbnail.alt_text: Illustration shows AI (Artificial Intelligence) letters and robot hand
thumbnail.subtitle: Illustration shows AI (Artificial Intelligence) letters and robot hand

articles.basic_headline: South Korea appeals tribunal ruling ordering $32 mln payment to Mason Capital
articles.title: South Korea appeals tribunal ruling ordering $32 mln payment to Mason Capital
articles.description: South Korea has appealed against a ruling by an international arbitration tribunal ordering it to pay $32 million to Mason Capital over a dispute stemming from a 2015 merger of two Samsung affiliates, its justice ministry said on Thursday.
articles.web: South Korea appeals tribunal ruling ordering $32 mln payment to Mason Capital

thumbnail.caption: A flag bearing the logo of Samsung flutters in front of its office building in Seoul, South Korea, October 25, 2020.    REUTERS/Kim Hong-Ji/File Photo
thumbnail.alt_text: A flag bearing the logo of Samsung flutters in front of its office building in Seoul
thumbnail.subtitle: A flag bearing the logo of Samsung flutters in front of its office building in Seoul

articles.basic_headline: A glitzy Indian wedding for the Ambani family to snarl Mumbai traffic
articles.title: A glitzy Indian wedding for the Ambani family to snarl Mumbai traffic
articles.description: When the son of Asia's richest person Mukesh Ambani marries this week, traffic in a key part of Mumbai will literally stop for the four-day extravaganza to be attended by a gamut of VIPs from former British prime ministers to Kim Kardashian.
articles.web: A glitzy Indian wedding for the Ambani family to snarl Mumbai traffic

thumbnail.caption: Anant Ambani, son of businessman Mukesh Ambani, arrives with his fiance Radhika Merchant on the red carpet during the sangeet ceremony at Jio World Centre, Mumbai, India, July 5, 2024. REUTERS/Hemanshi Kamani/File Photo
thumbnail.alt_text: Anant Ambani, son of businessman Mukesh Ambani during the sangeet ceremony at Jio World Centre, Mumbai
thumbnail.subtitle: Anant Ambani, son of businessman Mukesh Ambani during the sangeet ceremony at Jio World Centre, Mumbai

articles.basic_headline: Samsung bolsters AI in foldable phones, health monitoring in smartwatch, ring
articles.title: Samsung bolsters AI in foldable phones, health monitoring in smartwatch, ring
articles.description: Samsung Electronics unveiled its latest foldable smartphones on Wednesday, making its priciest flagship model lighter and slimmer and bolstering AI functions as it challenges Apple's dominance in the premium market.
articles.web: Samsung bolsters AI in foldable phones, health monitoring in smartwatch, ring

thumbnail.caption: An attendee films Samsung Electronics' new Galaxy Z Fold 6 during its unveiling ceremony in Seoul, South Korea, July 8, 2024.  REUTERS/Kim Hong-Ji
thumbnail.alt_text: Samsung to unveil new products, in Seoul
thumbnail.subtitle: Samsung to unveil new products, in Seoul

articles.basic_headline: Samsung Electronics' main South Korea union to go on indefinite strike
articles.title: Samsung Electronics' main South Korea union to go on indefinite strike
articles.description: Samsung Electronics' biggest workers' union in South Korea said on Wednesday it will continue a strike indefinitely, stepping up its campaign against the tech giant for better pay and benefits.
articles.web: Samsung Electronics' main South Korea union to go on indefinite strike

thumbnail.caption: The National Samsung Electronics Union (NSEU) workers shout slogans during a general strike to disrupt production between July 8 and 10, in front of the Samsung Electronics Nano City Hwaseong Campus in Hwaseong, South Korea, July 8, 2024. REUTERS/Kim Soo-hyeon/File Photo
thumbnail.alt_text: Samsung Electronics Union workers begin a three-day strike, in Hwaseong
thumbnail.subtitle: Samsung Electronics Union workers begin a three-day strike, in Hwaseong

articles.basic_headline: Samsung Electronics wins cutting-edge AI chip order from Japan's Preferred Networks
articles.title: Samsung Electronics wins cutting-edge AI chip order from Japan's Preferred Networks
articles.description: Samsung Electronics said on Tuesday it won an order from Japanese artificial intelligence company Preferred Networks to make chips for AI applications using the South Korean firm's 2-nanometre foundry process and advanced chip packaging service.
articles.web: Samsung Electronics wins cutting-edge AI chip order from Japan's Preferred Networks

thumbnail.caption: The logo of Samsung is seen on the top of a Brussels' office of the company in Diegem, Belgium September 21, 2023. REUTERS/Yves Herman/File Photo
thumbnail.alt_text: The logo of Samsung is seen on the top of a Brussels' office of the company in Diegem
thumbnail.subtitle: The logo of Samsung is seen on the top of a Brussels' office of the company in Diegem

articles.basic_headline: Samsung Electronics workers strike as union voice grows in South Korea
articles.title: Samsung Electronics workers strike as union voice grows in South Korea
articles.description: Samsung Electronics workers began a three-day strike for better pay on Monday, with their union pointing to further action should South Korea's biggest conglomerate continue to fall short of its demands.
articles.web: Samsung Electronics workers strike as union voice grows in South Korea

thumbnail.caption: The National Samsung Electronics Union (NSEU) workers hold placards during a general strike to disrupt production between July 8 and 10, in front of the Samsung Electronics Nano City Hwaseong Campus in Hwaseong, South Korea, July 8, 2024. REUTERS/Kim Soo-hyeon
thumbnail.alt_text: Samsung Electronics Union workers begin a three-day strike, in Hwaseong
thumbnail.subtitle: Samsung Electronics Union workers begin a three-day strike, in Hwaseong

articles.basic_headline: Corning raises second-quarter core sales forecast driven by AI boom
articles.title: Corning raises second-quarter core sales forecast driven by AI boom
articles.description: Corning raised its second-quarter core sales forecast on Monday, as demand for its fiber optic products surges with the rising adoption of generative AI technology, sending the specialty glass maker's shares up more than 9%.
articles.web: Corning raises second-quarter core sales forecast driven by AI boom

thumbnail.caption: A screen displays the logo for Corning Inc. at the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York, U.S., November 18, 2019. REUTERS/Brendan McDermid/File Photo
thumbnail.alt_text: A screen displays the logo for Corning Inc. at the NYSE in New York
thumbnail.subtitle: A screen displays the logo for Corning Inc. at the NYSE in New York

articles.basic_headline: Vietnam misses out on Intel, LG Chem investments due to lack of incentives, ministry document shows
articles.title: Vietnam misses out on Intel, LG Chem investments due to lack of incentives, ministry document shows
articles.description: Vietnam has missed out on multi-billion dollar investments by multinationals including Intel and LG Chem because it lacks sufficient investment incentives, the country's investment ministry said in a document reviewed by Reuters.
articles.web: Vietnam misses out on Intel, LG Chem investments due to lack of incentives, ministry document shows

thumbnail.alt_text: Reuters logo
thumbnail.subtitle: TOPIC:DEFAULT_TOPIC_THUMBNAIL

articles.basic_headline: Samsung flags better-than-expected profit rise as AI boom lifts chip prices
articles.title: Samsung flags better-than-expected profit rise as AI boom lifts chip prices
articles.description: Samsung Electronics estimated on Friday a more than 15-fold rise in its second-quarter operating profit, as rebounding semiconductor prices driven by the artificial intelligence boom lifted earnings from a low base a year ago.
articles.web: Samsung flags better-than-expected profit rise as AI boom lifts chip prices

thumbnail.caption: A visitor uses a Samsung Electronics' flagship smartphone Galaxy S24 during its unveiling ceremony in Seoul, South Korea, January 15, 2024. REUTERS/Kim Hong-Ji/File Photo
thumbnail.alt_text: Samsung to unveil new products, in Seoul
thumbnail.subtitle: Samsung to unveil new products, in Seoul

articles.basic_headline: AI frenzy expected to have boosted Samsung Q2 profit 13-fold
articles.title: AI frenzy expected to have boosted Samsung Q2 profit 13-fold
articles.description: Samsung Electronics is expected to post a 13-fold increase in second-quarter profit from a year earlier as demand for artificial intelligence technology fuels a rebound in memory chip prices.
articles.web: AI frenzy expected to have boosted Samsung Q2 profit 13-fold

thumbnail.alt_text: Media tour to Samsung Electronic' HQ in Suwon
thumbnail.subtitle: Media tour to Samsung Electronic' HQ in Suwon

articles.basic_headline: Samsung defeats consumers’ mass arbitration demand in US appeals court
articles.title: Samsung defeats consumers’ mass arbitration demand in US appeals court
articles.description: A U.S. appeals court has reversed a decision that would have required Samsung Electronics to pay millions of dollars in arbitration fees to respond to thousands of consumer privacy claims.
articles.web: Samsung defeats consumers’ mass arbitration demand in US appeals court

thumbnail.caption: REUTERS/Kim Hong-Ji
thumbnail.alt_text: Samsung to unveil new products, in Seoul
thumbnail.subtitle: Samsung to unveil new products, in Seoul

articles.basic_headline: Vietnam finalising plan for fund to attract foreign investment
articles.title: Vietnam finalising plan for fund to attract foreign investment
articles.description: Vietnam's Ministry of Planning and Investment is finalising a draft plan to set up a fund to help attract foreign investment and maintain the country's competitiveness, according to a ministry document reviewed by Reuters.
articles.web: Vietnam finalising plan for fund to attract foreign investment

articles.basic_headline: Samsung Electronics workers to strike on July 8-10, union says
articles.title: Samsung Electronics workers to strike on July 8-10, union says
articles.description: A workers' union at Samsung Electronics in South Korea has called a strike for July 8-10, union officials said on Tuesday, as it steps up industrial action against the country's most valuable company.
articles.web: Samsung Electronics workers to strike on July 8-10, union says

thumbnail.caption: Son Woo-mok, president of National Samsung Electronics Union, looks up at the company building while staging a walkout protest, in Seoul, South Korea, June 7, 2024.    REUTERS/Kim Hong-Ji/File Photo
thumbnail.alt_text: Samsung Electronics union in South Korea stages first walkout
thumbnail.subtitle: Samsung Electronics union in South Korea stages first walkout

articles.basic_headline: Samsung Electronics union in South Korea declares general strike
articles.title: Samsung Electronics union in South Korea declares general strike
articles.description: A workers' union at Samsung Electronics in South Korea said on Monday it would launch a general strike until its demands for better pay and time off were met, warning of more damaging action against the country's most powerful conglomerate than its one-day walkout last month.
articles.web: Samsung Electronics union in South Korea declares general strike
